excerpt: Modest museum with displays tracing the history & culture of the islands' tribal communities.
detail_description: The Zonal Anthropological Museum is a modest yet cherished museum that offers a detailed insight into the cultural and tribal life of Andaman. It features exhibits showcasing the history and traditions of the islands' tribal communities, including clothing, utensils, weapons, and other historical artifacts from tribes such as the Jarawas, Sentinelese, Great Andamanese, and Onges.
name: Zonal Anthropological Museum
address: anthropological museum, Thomas Colony, Junglighat, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744101, India

excerpt: Museum showcasing marine life & island history with coral, fish, shells & many items for sale.
detail_description: The Naval Marine Museum Samudrika, located in Port Blair, is a renowned attraction in Andaman that offers a fascinating display of marine life and island history. The museum boasts an extensive collection of coral, fish, shells, and other marine artifacts. Visitors can also find various items for sale at the museum. Notable exhibits include rare specimens such as the dugong, a rarely seen sea mammal, and the giant robber crab, an impressive crustacean known for its imposing size.
name: Naval Marine Museum Samudrika
address: road, Airport Authority Colony, Haddo, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744102, India

excerpt: Former 1900s prison complex, now a memorial & museum with grisly dioramas depicting inmates’ lives.
detail_description: Cellular Jail, also known as Kala Pani, is a former prison complex in India that has been transformed into a memorial and museum. It holds grim dioramas depicting the harsh lives of its inmates. The jail played a significant role in India's fight for independence, symbolizing the struggles and endurance of hundreds of freedom fighters who faced inhumane conditions and brutal treatment by jailors. Visiting this historic site offers insight into the untold miseries endured by these brave individuals.
name: Cellular Jail
address: Atlanta Point, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744104, India

detail_description: The Japanese Bunker in Port Blair is a historical site built by Japanese soldiers during World War II. These bunkers, located near Corbyns Cove, serve as a testament to the protection needed during wartime. Constructed between 1942 and 1945, they were part of the Japanese army's invasion of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands. Visiting this place offers a unique experience and insight into foreign invasions during that time period.
name: Japanese Bunker
address: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Island, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands, India

excerpt: Scuba diving & glass-bottom boat trips at a palm-covered island with a candy-striped lighthouse.
detail_description: North Bay Island in Andaman is a paradise for underwater activities. It offers scuba diving, snorkeling, and a unique undersea walk that allows you to explore the marine life without diving deep into the sea. The island also provides thrilling water sports at Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex in Port Blair and Elephant Beach and Nemo Reef on Havelock Island.
name: North Bay underwater activity
address: Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744107, India

excerpt: Sandy, palm-fringed beach with jet-ski rentals, lounge chairs & several casual eateries.
detail_description: Corbyn’s Cove Beach, located 9 kilometers from Port Blair, is a picturesque sandy beach lined with coconut palm trees. It offers various activities such as swimming, sunbathing, and water sports like jet-ski rentals. The area also serves as a starting point for exploring nearby attractions including the famous Cellular Jail and several museums. In the evening, visitors can enjoy the captivating Sound and Light Show at Cellular Jail which brings alive the heroic saga of India's freedom struggle.
name: Corbyn’s Cove Beach
address: JPWX+27M, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744101, India

excerpt: Old location of a British-run prison for convicts & political prisoners, with historic ruins.
detail_description: Viper Island, located near Port Blair in the Andaman and Nicobar Islands, holds great historical significance as it was once a British prison for convicts and political prisoners. The remains of the jail built in 1867 can still be seen on this serene island. It played a crucial role in India's struggle for independence and is now a popular tourist destination with its historic ruins and picturesque picnic spots.
name: Viper Island
address: Andaman and Nicobar Islands

detail_description: Corbyns Cove Beach is a must-visit destination in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, conveniently situated near Port Blair. This secluded and unspoiled beach boasts lush coconut trees and tranquil blue waters that instantly soothe visitors. The shoreline offers beach chairs for relaxation while enjoying the mesmerizing waves crashing on the coast. As the only tourist beach in Port Blair, Corbyns Cove Beach is a serene retreat for travelers seeking natural beauty and tranquility.
name: Corbyns Cove Beach
address: Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744112, India

excerpt: Large sawmill with an educational museum on the forestry industry, plus wooden artwork for sale.
detail_description: Forest Museum, located in Port Blair, is part of the Chatham Government Saw Mill complex established in 1883. It is one of the oldest and largest operational sawmills in Asia. The museum offers an educational experience on the forestry industry and showcases a collection of wooden art and sculptures made by the mill workers, depicting the region's flora and fauna. Visitors can also purchase wooden artwork at this museum.
name: Forest Museum
address: MPQF+4G4, Chatham Island, Foreshore Rd, Haddo, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744102, India

detail_description: Dispensary, Chatham Saw Mill is a historic site located in Port Blair, known for being the oldest and largest sawmill in Asia. It supplies timber for construction on the island and exports to industries worldwide. The mill's planks are even said to have been used in the construction of Buckingham Palace. Visitors can tour the open sawmill during designated times and explore a museum showcasing wooden arts and statues representing Andaman's diverse cultures and traditions.
name: Dispensary, Chatham Saw Mill
address: MPQF+8Q2, Foreshore Rd, Haddo, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744102, India

detail_description: Sri Vetrimalai Murugan Temple, located in the Andaman Islands, is a significant pilgrimage site known for its stunning Dravidian architecture and intricate artwork. Built in 1926 during British colonial rule to appease Tamil residents, this temple is dedicated to Lord Murugan, also known as Karthikeyan, the son of Lord Shiva and Parvati. It attracts devotees year-round and especially during Hindu festivals.
name: Murugan Temple
address: MP7W+7H2, RGT Rd, Shadipur, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744106, India

excerpt: Small park with scenic views, kids' play areas & a long pier with access to boating & water sports.
detail_description: Marina Park, also known as Samudrika Marine Park, is a small yet picturesque park located on the pristine coastlines of Port Blair in Andaman. It offers scenic views, kids' play areas, and a long pier providing access to boating and water sports. Adjacent to the park is the Rajiv Gandhi Water Sports Complex and the Marine Aquarium. The nearby Children's Traffic Park provides an educational experience for youngsters.
name: Marina Park
address: MP9W+WXM, Rajiv Gandhi Nagar, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744104, India

detail_description: Tiranga Memorial, also known as the Netaji Flag Hoisting Memorial, is a must-visit historical site in the Andaman Islands that resonates with patriotism and heritage. This significant landmark marks the spot where Subhas Chandra Bose hoisted the Indian Tricolor for the first time on December 30, 1943, declaring these islands a free territory.
name: Tiranga Memorial (Flag Point)
address: MQ84+G3F, Corbyns Cove Rd, South Point, Shadipur, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744106, India

detail_description: Jogger's Park in Port Blair offers a unique experience for aviation enthusiasts, providing a clear view of Veer Savarkar International Airport's runway where planes land and take off. The park is well-maintained with ample parking space and a clean environment. While photography restrictions may deter some visitors, the park's elevated location provides an excellent vantage point to observe airport activities.
name: Jogger's Park
address: AHW Colony, Shadipur, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744101, India

excerpt: Exhibits exploring the history of the Andaman & Nicobar islands through photos, paintings & models.
detail_description: Kalapani Museum in Port Blair is a one-of-a-kind private history museum housed in a three-story building. It showcases the history of the Andaman & Nicobar islands through an extensive collection of rare archival photographs, paintings, and artifacts from tribes and historical periods. The museum features miniature and life-size models, dioramas, and original documents from Colonial and Japanese eras. Visitors can also watch documentaries and films related to the island's history and the Indian Freedom Struggle.
name: Kalapani Museum
address: II, beside Susan's Roses, Garacharama, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744105, India

excerpt: Former 1900s prison complex, now a memorial & museum with grisly dioramas depicting inmates’ lives.
detail_description: The Cellular Jail Museum is a well-maintained memorial and museum with grisly dioramas depicting inmates' lives. The museum closes around 4 PM, after which entry is not allowed, but the informative sound and light show can be booked well in advance online. Highly recommend attending that when you are in Port Blair.
name: Cellular Jail
address: Atlanta Point, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744104, India

detail_description: Sagarika Emporium, a Government initiative in Port Blair, showcases the exquisite artistry and craftsmanship of the Andamanese people. The emporium offers a delightful variety of meticulously handmade products including wooden carvings, coconut lamp shades, seashell murals, and wooden trays. This platform provides local artisans with an opportunity for self-employment by showcasing their skills in crafting items from wood, seashells, and jute.
name: Sagarika Emporium, Government Emporium
address: MP7P+PGM, DAG Colony, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744101, India

detail_description: When visiting Port Blair, don't miss out on the vibrant Aberdeen Bazar, a bustling market where you can hone your bargaining skills. As the main market in the area, it offers an array of roadside stalls and government emporiums selling a diverse range of goods. Whether you're looking for souvenirs or local handicrafts, this is the place to immerse yourself in the lively atmosphere and shop to your heart's content.
name: Aberdeen Bazar
address: Aberdeen, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744101, India

detail_description: Veer Savarkar Park, located in front of the Cellular Jail in Port Blair, is a well-maintained park surrounded by lush greenery. It features a remarkable collection of statues honoring freedom fighters. Visitors can take a break here after touring the jail or before attending the light and sound show. Additionally, the park offers opportunities for Night Kayak & Day Kayak experiences, making it a unique destination for outdoor activities.
name: Veer Savarkar Park
address: Atlanta Point, Sri Vijaya Puram, Andaman and Nicobar Islands 744104, India

excerpt: Serene island with a storied past, historic ruins of a British penal colony, a lighthouse & beaches.
detail_description: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Island, formerly known as Ross Island, is a serene and historically significant destination near Port Blair. Once an important British administrative center, the island now features historic ruins of a penal colony, a lighthouse, and beautiful beaches. Visitors can explore remnants of British-era structures such as the Chief Commissioner's House and the church while enjoying the lush greenery and tranquil ambiance. The island is open from 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM for exploration.
name: Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose Island
address: Andaman and Nicobar Islands
